meanings.definition: Practice intensively on a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: She spends hours woodshedding on her guitar every day.
meanings.sent2: The musician was woodshedding for the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent3: He was caught woodshedding in his room instead of doing his homework.
meanings.sent4: The pianist's dedication to woodshedding paid off during the performance.
meanings.sent5: Woodshedding is essential for mastering any musical instrument.

meanings.definition: To rehearse or practice a skill in private.
meanings.sent1: Before the big game, the team was woodshedding their plays.
meanings.sent2: The magician was woodshedding his tricks before the show.
meanings.sent3: She was woodshedding her speech in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The chef was woodshedding his new recipe in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: Woodshedding in private helps improve skills without distractions.
